overview_of_class:
Fundamentals of human disorders; engineering aspects of regenerative medicine; application of regenerative engineering to human disease.

This course is designed for senior undergraduate and graduate students.
name: Regenerative Engineering Applications
title: MEAS BMD_ENG 349-2-20 Regenerative Engineering Applications

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Fundamentals of human disorders; engineering aspects of regenerative medicine; application of regenerative engineering to human disease.

This course is designed for senior undergraduate and graduate students.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Engineering aspects of regenerative medicine
Genetic human disorders
Environmental factor-induced human disorders
Principles of engineering-based treatment of human disease
Brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerve injury
Stroke
Alzheimer's and Parkinson's disease
Corneal injury
Glaucoma
Heart attack
Valvular heart disorders
Atherosclerosis
Aneurysm
Liver injury and cirrhosis
Diabetes
Kidney injury
Skin injury
Bone injury

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Shu Q. Liu, Bioregenerative Engineering: Principles and Applications, Wiley Interscience, New Jersey, 2007.

Shu Q. Liu, Cardiovascular Protective and Regenerative Engineering, World Scientific, 2017 (tentatively).

subject: BMD_ENG
